results.headline: Japan Chip Gear Sales Seen Climbing 15% This Fiscal Year on AI
results.summary: Sales of Japanese chipmaking tools is expected to rise 15% in the year to March 2025, thanks to an AI-fueled recovery in spending on memory capacity, an industry group said.

results.authors: By Chian-Wei Teo and Yihui Xie
results.headline: Pipeline Deal: The Bloomberg Close, Asia Edition
results.summary: Good afternoon. Here’s what you need to know to end your day.

results.authors: By Heejin Kim and Gabrielle Coppola
results.headline: LG Sees Battery Breakthrough by 2028 That Has Eluded Tesla
results.summary: LG Energy Solution Ltd. is aiming to commercialize what’s been described as a game changing battery-making technology by 2028, opening a path for the Korean cell manufacturer to become more competitive with Chinese rivals.

results.authors: By Min Jeong Lee and Yuki Furukawa
results.headline: Ex-Banker Behind Chipmaker Renesas Chases $100 Billion Value
results.summary: A decade ago, Renesas Electronics Corp. was under government control and bleeding cash. Now worth $35 billion, the Japanese chipmaker is targeting a market value of around $100 billion by 2030, thanks to a string of overseas acquisitions.

results.headline: US to Fight Labor Shortage With New Chips Act Worker Program
results.summary: The Biden administration is kicking off a program to cultivate the US computer-chip workforce, aiming to stave off a labor shortage that threatens to undermine domestic semiconductor production.

results.authors: By Farah Elbahrawy, Sagarika Jaisinghani, and Alexandra Semenova
results.headline: BlackRock, BNP See Plenty of AI Fuel Left to Drive Equity Rally
results.summary: The artificial intelligence frenzy is nowhere near finished driving global equities to record highs, according to money managers interviewed by Bloomberg News.

results.headline: Samsung Electronics’ Labor Union to Stage Three-Day Strike
results.summary: The largest union at Samsung Electronics Co. said it will stage a three-day walkout beginning July 8, adding to the challenges for South Korea’s largest company as it seeks to recover from setbacks in its semiconductor business.

results.headline: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day: Asia
results.summary: Good morning. Manufacturing worries emerge in the world’s biggest economies. Wall Street ponders a Donald Trump presidency. China’s best-selling car brand boosts sales. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Kristine Aquino

results.headline: Korean Stocks Outshine Bonds as Global Investors Bet on AI
results.summary: For the first time in two decades, South Korean stocks are getting more love than local bonds from global investors amid rising interest in the country’s chip sector.

results.authors: By Sam Kim and Jenny Seung Min Lee
results.headline: South Korea’s Export Growth Accelerates on Record Chip Sales
results.summary: South Korea’s export growth accelerated last month, reflecting resilience in global demand as the artificial intelligence and technology sectors drive record gains in semiconductor sales.
